titles.title: To amend title 5, United States Code, to increase by 1 year the maximum age through which an unmarried dependent child may continue to receive health benefits coverage as a family member, so long as such child remains a full-time student.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E459)
Referred to the House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

committee.name: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Compensation and Employee Benefits.

committee.name: House Post Office and Civil Service
House Post Office and Civil Service

bill.summary: 2/25/1993--Introduced. Amends Federal law to increase by one year the maximum age through which an unmarried dependent child of a Federal employee or official may continue to receive Federal health benefits coverage as a family member as long as such child remains a full-time student.
